intro: Lagedium sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes various other notable plants like buttercups and anemones. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically palmately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lagedium sibiricum is adapted to harsh, alpine environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
